bibl.title: P. Mich. Inv. 4953: A School Poem on Mythology.
bibl.note: Recto: a nearly illegible account. Verso: part of a poem used as a writing exercise. Each of the three complete hexameters deals with a different mythological event. The lines are arranged so as to form an alphabetic acrostic. Provenance unknown, iii AD.
bibl.seg: Daniel Robert W., P. Mich. Inv. 4953: A School Poem on Mythology.
ZPE 49 (1982) pp. 43-44 et pl. I c.

Recto: a nearly illegible account. Verso: part of a poem used as a writing exercise. Each of the three complete hexameters deals with a different mythological event. The lines are arranged so as to form an alphabetic acrostic. Provenance unknown, iii AD.
